shortDescription.text: CVE-2020-8908: Improper Handling of Alternate Encoding

help.text: A temp directory creation vulnerability exists in Guava prior to version 32.0.0 allowing an attacker with access to the machine to potentially access data in a temporary directory created by the Guava `com.google.common.io.Files.createTempDir()`. The permissions granted to the directory created default to the standard unix-like /tmp ones, leaving the files open. Maintainers recommend explicitly changing the permissions after the creation of the directory, or removing uses of the vulnerable method.
help.markdown:
> A temp directory creation vulnerability exists in Guava prior to version 32.0.0 allowing an attacker with access to the machine to potentially access data in a temporary directory created by the Guava `com.google.common.io.Files.createTempDir()`. The permissions granted to the directory created default to the standard unix-like /tmp ones, leaving the files open. Maintainers recommend explicitly changing the permissions after the creation of the directory, or removing uses of the vulnerable method.


|                |                                              |
|----------------|----------------------------------------------|
| Package        | pkg:maven/com.google.guava/guava@13.0.1      |
| Affected range | <32.0.0                                      |
| Fixed version  | 32.0.0                                       |
| CVSS Score     |                                          3.3 |
| CVSS Vector    | CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N |

shortDescription.text: CVE-2023-2976: Creation of Temporary File in Directory with Insecure Permissions

help.text:
Use of Java's default temporary directory for file creation in `FileBackedOutputStream` in Google Guava versions 1.0 to 31.1 on Unix systems and Android Ice Cream Sandwich allows other users and apps on the machine with access to the default Java temporary directory to be able to access the files created by the class.

Even though the security vulnerability is fixed in version 32.0.0, maintainers recommend using version 32.0.1 as version 32.0.0 breaks some functionality under Windows.
help.markdown:
> Use of Java's default temporary directory for file creation in `FileBackedOutputStream` in Google Guava versions 1.0 to 31.1 on Unix systems and Android Ice Cream Sandwich allows other users and apps on the machine with access to the default Java temporary directory to be able to access the files created by the class.

Even though the security vulnerability is fixed in version 32.0.0, maintainers recommend using version 32.0.1 as version 32.0.0 breaks some functionality under Windows.

help.text: A flaw was discovered in FasterXML jackson-databind that permits polymorphic deserialization of malicious objects. Specifically when the xalan JNDI gadget is used in conjunction with polymorphic type handling methods such as `enableDefaultTyping()`. The gadget may also be combined with `@JsonTypeInfo` when it is using `Id.CLASS` or `Id.MINIMAL_CLASS`, or in any other way which `ObjectMapper.readValue` might instantiate objects from unsafe sources. An attacker could use this flaw to execute arbitrary code.
help.markdown:
> A flaw was discovered in FasterXML jackson-databind that permits polymorphic deserialization of malicious objects. Specifically when the xalan JNDI gadget is used in conjunction with polymorphic type handling methods such as `enableDefaultTyping()`. The gadget may also be combined with `@JsonTypeInfo` when it is using `Id.CLASS` or `Id.MINIMAL_CLASS`, or in any other way which `ObjectMapper.readValue` might instantiate objects from unsafe sources. An attacker could use this flaw to execute arbitrary code.

help.text: A Polymorphic Typing issue was discovered in FasterXML jackson-databind 2.0.0 through 2.9.10. When Default Typing is enabled (either globally or for a specific property) for an externally exposed JSON endpoint and the service has the commons-dbcp (1.4) jar in the classpath, and an attacker can find an RMI service endpoint to access, it is possible to make the service execute a malicious payload. This issue exists because of org.apache.commons.dbcp.datasources.SharedPoolDataSource and org.apache.commons.dbcp.datasources.PerUserPoolDataSource mishandling.
